sentence.Network_en: He had still the linstock of his gun in his own hand.
sentence.Network_cn: 他自己的手里还拿着放炮的火绳杆.

PerfectNetExp.abs: linsey-woolsey 棉毛织品linstock 火绳杆lint 软麻布

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from earlier lintstock, from Dutch lontstok, from lont 'match' + stok 'stick'. The change in the first syllable was due to association with lint

means.word_mean: 1. a stick about a meter long with a point on one end (to stick in the ground) and a forked head on the other end (to hold a lighted match); formerly used to fire cannons
